modName: A Preset for FXAA Post Process Injector Version 2
summary: Waning Gibbous presents: A Preset for FXAA Post Process Injector V2.2.  Try it... you\'ll like it!
descriptionHtml:
The goal here is to have a nice, natural looking environment.  I hope you enjoy it.  Please comment and endorse if you like it... 

Please do not re-post this mod anywhere else, this is a Nexus exclusive.

[color=#fc0][b][size=2]VERSION 2.2 now has four presets![/size][/b][/color]

[color=#fc0][b][size=2]VERSION 2.2[/size][/b][/color]
[color=#09f][b]INSTALLATION:[/b][/color]
Uninstall FXAA Post Process Injector V1.3 (if you have it installed).
Install [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=131]FXAA Post Process Injector V2.1[/url] by some_dude (I installed his 4th preset).
In the folder \"injFX_Shaders\", replace the \"UserSettings.h\" with one of these (drag it into folder or copy and paste).
Double click to run \"FXAA_Tool.exe\", (this loads the new preset)
Close the \"FXAA_Tool.exe\"
Play game.

Preset 1 has Bloom, Tonemap, PostSharpen
Preset 2 has Tonemap, PostSharpen
Preset 3 has Bloom, Technicolor, Tonemap, PostSharpen
Preset 4 is for people with darker monitors or like lighter looking enviroments. One preset has bloom the other doesnt.

Please endorse me if you value my efforts.

Note: the pictures posted here are to give you a rough idea what the preset looks like.  You really won\'t know until you try it for yourself  ( that goes for anyones presets).

=======================================================================

[color=red][b]NOTE:[/b][/color] My versions 1.1 and older DO NOT WORK on the FXAA PPI Version 2.  Use FXAA PPI version 1.3.

[color=#09f][b]INSTALLATION for FXAA PPI V1.3:[/b][/color]
Install [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=131]FXAA Post Process Injector[/url] by some_dude (I used his 2nd preset option).
Replace that injFX_Settings.h with this one.
Play game.

=======================================================================

[size=2]The rest of this page is about making your own adjustments.  If you are not interested in that dont read any further.[/size]



[color=#fc0][b][size=2]VERSION 1.1[/size][/b][/color]
I renamed this V1.1 (It was V2) so as not to be confusing with the new FXAA PPI V2.
A little lighter, a little less bloom, and a little bluer.  This is not a replacement for version 1, just a little different.
Edit as you would the original below.
Reduced #define Gamma 1.25
Reduced float BloomThreshold = 1.0; 
Reduced float BloomWidth = 1.00; 
Reduced float BloomPower = 1.00;
Increased #define BlueShift -0.07

=======================================================================
[color=#fc0][b][size=2]VERSION 1[/size][/b][/color]
ONLY SHOWING THE SETTINGS I CHANGED.

[color=#09f][b]TO MAKE CHANGES:[/b][/color]
Open the injFX_Settings.h file in notepad or your favorite text editor.  I use Notepad++.

If you run your game in windowed mode you need to exit game and restart game to see changes.  In full screen mode alt+tab to see changes.

[color=red][b]NOTE:[/b][/color] If it looks too green to you then change in [color=#0c0][b]TONEMAP:[/b][/color] #define BlueShift -0.09 to 0.0 (Or something greater than -0.09... -0.05 for instance) SEE BELOW...

[color=red][b]NOTE:[/b][/color] If its too dark at night pressing your Pause/Break key on your keyboard will disable settings.  My companion carries a torch, I also use candlelight spell often.

[color=red][b]NOTE:[/b][/color]  If its too dark in the daytime (Or at night) reducing [color=#0c0][b]TONEMAP:[/b][/color] #define Gamma will lighten the picture.  So will increasing the #define Exposure.

Change these [color=#f30][b]values[/b][/color]
[color=#0c0][b]BLOOM:[/b][/color]
float BloomPreset = [color=#f30]0[/color]; // Disabled = 0.  Valid Preset Values = 1 to 9.  Preset value 1 to 9 takes control over the next 3 settings.  Original setting was 5.
float BloomThreshold = [color=#f30]2.4[/color]; // The min. level at which the effect starts.  Valid Values = 1 to 9, use decimals for fine tuning.  Original setting was 1.0
float BloomWidth = [color=#f30]1.00[/color]; // Sets the width of the effect.  Valid Values = 1 to 9, use decimals for fine tuning  Original setting was 1.0
float BloomPower = [color=#f30]2.15[/color]; // The power of the effect.  Valid Values = 1 to 9, use decimals for fine tuning  Original setting was 1.0


[color=#0c0][b]TECHNICOLOR:[/b][/color]
#define TechniAmount [color=#f30]0.05[/color] // 1.00 = Max.  Lower number = more vibrant.  Original setting was .30
#define TechniPower [color=#f30]4.8[/color] // lower values = whitening.  Original setting was 4.5

Lower values = stronger channel.  I needed more red... you may not!
#define redNegativeAmount [color=#f30].94[/color]  // 1.00 = Max  Original setting was 1.0
#define greenNegativeAmount [color=#f30]1.00[/color] // 1.00 = Max
#define blueNegativeAmount [color=#f30]1.00[/color] // 1.00 = Max


[color=#0c0][b]TONEMAP:[/b][/color]
increasing Gamma darkens the picture.  Increasing Exposure brightens the picture.  
#define Gamma [color=#f30]1.27[/color]  //Larger number = darker picture. Original setting was 1.10
#define Exposure [color=#f30]0.20[/color]  //Larger number = lighter picture. Original setting was -0.10
#define Saturation [color=#f30]-0.20[/color]  // use negative values for less saturation.  Original setting was 0.70
#define BlueShift [color=#f30]-0.09[/color]  // Higher = more blue in image.  My image was way too blue hence the negative number.  Original setting was 0.00


[color=#0c0][b]POST_SHARPEN:[/b][/color]
float Sharpen = [color=#f30]0.04[/color];  // Original setting was 0.05

Thats it!
===============================================================================================


[b]CREDITS:  Thanks to:[/b]
Everyone that worked on the Post Process Injector.
The nexusnetwork.
Bethesda.
To all the modders that make these games great!

[b]CHANGELOG:[/b]
2.2 Uploaded file.
2.1 Uploaded file.
2.0 Uploaded file.
1.1 Uploaded file.
1.0 Uploaded file.
author: Waning Gibbous
